description: Assesses emotional intelligence traits (self-awareness, self-regulation, empathy, social skills, motivation) to guide academic and career choices for students in 10th, 11th/12th, and UG levels.

questions.question_text: How well do you recognize your emotions when facing a challenge?

options.text: I always recognize and understand my emotions.
I usually recognize my emotions with some effort.
I rarely notice my emotions during challenges.
It depends on the situation.

questions.explanation: High self-awareness suits fields requiring emotional resilience, like MBBS or B.Ed; moderate suits BBA; low may align with technical fields like BCA.

questions.question_text: How do you manage stress during tight deadlines?

options.text: I stay calm and use effective coping strategies.
I manage but sometimes feel overwhelmed.
I often struggle to stay calm.
I use specific techniques like planning or breathing.

questions.explanation: Strong self-regulation is key for high-pressure fields like CA or MBBS; moderate suits B.Com; techniques suit collaborative fields like BBA.

questions.question_text: How do you respond when a friend is upset?

options.text: I listen carefully and offer support.
I try to help but may not fully understand.
I find it hard to relate and may avoid it.
I offer advice based on the situation.

questions.explanation: High empathy suits supportive roles like B.Ed or MSW; moderate suits BBA; low may align with analytical fields like BCA.

questions.question_text: How comfortable are you working in a team?

options.text: Very comfortable, I thrive in teams.
Somewhat comfortable, I prefer a balance.
Not comfortable, I prefer working alone.
It depends on the team dynamics.

questions.explanation: Strong social skills suit collaborative fields like BBA or Mass Communication; low suits independent roles like BCS or B.Tech.

questions.question_text: How motivated are you to achieve your academic goals?

options.text: Highly motivated, I set and pursue clear goals.
Moderately motivated, I work steadily.
Not very motivated, I need external push.
My motivation depends on the subject.

questions.explanation: High motivation suits demanding fields like MBBS or CA; moderate suits B.Com; context-dependent suits creative fields like BFA.

questions.question_text: How often do you reflect on your feelings after a disagreement?

options.text: Always, I analyze my emotions carefully.
Sometimes, if the disagreement was significant.
Rarely, I move on quickly.
It depends on the situation.

questions.explanation: High self-awareness suits fields like B.Ed or MSW; moderate suits BBA; low may align with technical fields like BCA.

questions.question_text: How do you control impulsive reactions during arguments?

options.text: I stay calm and think before responding.
I try to stay calm but sometimes react.
I often react impulsively.
I use techniques like pausing or breathing.

questions.explanation: Strong self-regulation is key for high-stakes fields like MBBS or CA; moderate suits B.Com; techniques suit collaborative fields like BBA.

questions.question_text: How do you understand a classmate’s perspective during a group project?

options.text: I actively listen and empathize fully.
I try to understand but may miss nuances.
I focus on my own perspective.
I ask questions to clarify their view.

questions.explanation: High empathy suits supportive roles like B.Ed or MSW; moderate suits BBA; low may align with analytical fields like BCS.

questions.question_text: How do you handle conflicts with peers?

options.text: I resolve conflicts calmly and diplomatically.
I try to resolve but may get frustrated.
I avoid conflicts or struggle to resolve them.
I address conflicts based on the situation.

questions.explanation: Strong social skills suit collaborative fields like BBA or Mass Communication; low suits independent roles like BCA.

questions.question_text: How driven are you to complete challenging tasks?

options.text: Very driven, I push through obstacles.
Somewhat driven, I need some motivation.
Not very driven, I may give up.
My drive depends on the task’s importance.

questions.explanation: High motivation suits rigorous fields like MBBS or CA; moderate suits B.Com; context-dependent suits creative fields like BFA.

questions.question_text: How aware are you of your strengths and weaknesses?

options.text: Very aware, I reflect regularly.
Somewhat aware, I notice occasionally.
Not very aware, I don’t think about it.
It depends on the context.

questions.explanation: High self-awareness suits fields like B.Ed or MSW; moderate suits BBA; low may align with technical fields like B.Tech.

questions.question_text: How do you handle frustration when a task is not going well?

options.text: I stay calm and refocus on solutions.
I get frustrated but try to push through.
I often lose patience and give up.
I take a break and reassess.

questions.explanation: Strong self-regulation suits high-pressure fields like MBBS or CA; moderate suits B.Com; reassessment suits BBA.

questions.question_text: How do you respond to a classmate’s failure?

options.text: I offer support and encouragement.
I sympathize but don’t get involved.
I don’t pay much attention.
I suggest ways to improve.

questions.explanation: High empathy suits supportive roles like B.Ed or MSW; moderate suits BBA; low may align with analytical fields like BCS.

questions.question_text: How do you build relationships with new classmates?

options.text: I actively connect and build trust.
I connect if we share interests.
I prefer to keep to myself.
It depends on the situation.

questions.explanation: Strong social skills suit collaborative fields like BBA or Mass Communication; low suits independent roles like BCA.

questions.question_text: How do you stay motivated during repetitive tasks?

options.text: I focus on long-term goals.
I find ways to stay engaged.
I lose interest quickly.
It depends on the task’s purpose.

questions.explanation: High motivation suits rigorous fields like MBBS or CA; moderate suits B.Com; context-dependent suits creative fields like BFA.

questions.question_text: How often do you notice your emotional triggers?

options.text: Frequently, I’m very aware of them.
Sometimes, if I reflect on it.
Rarely, I don’t focus on triggers.
It depends on the situation.

questions.explanation: High self-awareness suits fields like B.Ed or MSW; moderate suits BBA; low may align with technical fields like B.Tech.

questions.question_text: How do you handle criticism from a teacher?

options.text: I accept it calmly and improve.
I consider it but may feel upset.
I find it hard to accept and get defensive.
I analyze it before responding.

questions.explanation: Strong self-regulation suits high-pressure fields like MBBS or CA; moderate suits B.Com; analytical response suits BBA.

questions.question_text: How do you support a struggling team member?

options.text: I offer empathetic support and guidance.
I help if asked but focus on my tasks.
I don’t get involved.
I suggest practical solutions.

questions.explanation: High empathy suits supportive roles like B.Ed or MSW; moderate suits BBA; low may align with analytical fields like BCS.

questions.question_text: How do you persuade others to agree with your ideas?

options.text: I communicate clearly and build consensus.
I try to persuade but may struggle.
I avoid persuading and stick to my views.
I adapt my approach based on the audience.

questions.explanation: Strong social skills suit collaborative fields like BBA or Mass Communication; moderate suits B.Com; adaptive suits MBA.

questions.question_text: How do you stay motivated after a setback?

options.text: I refocus on my goals and push forward.
I recover slowly but keep going.
I struggle to regain motivation.
I seek inspiration to move forward.

questions.explanation: High motivation suits rigorous fields like MBBS or CA; moderate suits B.Com; inspiration-seeking suits creative fields like BFA.

questions.question_text: How do you identify your emotions during group discussions?

options.text: I’m very aware and manage them well.
I notice them but may not manage well.
I don’t focus on my emotions.
It depends on the discussion.

questions.explanation: High self-awareness suits fields like B.Ed or MSW; moderate suits BBA; low may align with technical fields like BCA.

questions.question_text: How do you manage anger during a disagreement?

options.text: I stay calm and express myself clearly.
I try to stay calm but may show frustration.
I often get angry and react strongly.
I step back to cool off before responding.

questions.explanation: Strong self-regulation suits high-pressure fields like MBBS or CA; moderate suits B.Com; stepping back suits BBA.

questions.question_text: How do you understand a teacher’s perspective when they give feedback?

options.text: I empathize and see their point of view.
I try to understand but focus on my perspective.
I don’t consider their perspective much.
I ask for clarification to understand.

questions.explanation: High empathy suits supportive roles like B.Ed or MSW; moderate suits BBA; low may align with analytical fields like BCS.

questions.question_text: How do you lead a group discussion?

options.text: I guide it effectively and include everyone.
I try to lead but may overlook some voices.
I avoid leading and let others take charge.
I lead only when necessary.

questions.explanation: Strong social skills suit leadership fields like BBA or MBA; moderate suits B.Com; low suits independent roles like BCA.

questions.question_text: How do you stay motivated for long-term goals?

options.text: I set clear goals and stay focused.
I work toward goals but may lose focus.
I struggle to stay motivated long-term.
I find motivation through milestones.

questions.explanation: High motivation suits rigorous fields like MBBS or CA; moderate suits B.Com; milestone-driven suits creative fields like BFA.
